document.title: SP341-M-Yellowjacket Wasps in Tennessee

author.organization: The University of Tennessee Agricultural Extension Service

document.abstract: In Tennessee, 11 species of yellowjackete wasps can be found (Table 1). These wasps are often considered beneficial as predators of crop pests; however, in late summer they can be pests due to their stinging behavior. This factsheet summarizes information about yellowjacket identification, biology, behavior and lists options for control when needed.
document.publication-title: Insects, Pests, Plant Diseases and Weeds
